Wang" about: id: about-heading template: trestles image: profile.jpg image-width: 14.5em links: - icon: twitter text: Twitter href: https://twitter.com/raphael_cwang - icon: github text: GitHub href: https://github.com/Raphaellie - icon: file-person-fill text: CV href: assets/cv/Wang-CV.pdf - icon: bar-chart-fill text: Quarto href: https://rpubs.com/dsanchezp998 --- ::: {#about-heading} # Hi There! I grew up in an industrial town in Chongqing, China, and went to Beijing for my undergraduate education. Currently I am a senior of Philosophy, Politics and Economics[^1] at Peking University. I also go by Raphael, my Catholic name. Broadly interested in race and ethnic politics and political behavior in the realm of American politics, I study the dynamics between racial identities and political polarization. My research examines how racial imageries---people's racialized imagination of politically relevant categories---shape people's perception of politics, and drive a diversifying America toward affective as well as ideological extremes. To accurately capture the content of racial imageries and their political implications, I draw upon an extensive range of data sources including public opinion surveys, census data, and administrative records. ::: [^1]: Rather than three individual majors as it may confusingly sound like, Philosophy, Politics and Economics (PPE) is actually one combined, interdisciplinary major that [originates from the University of Oxford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophy,_politics_and_economics) in the 1920s.
A passionate ``{=html} user[^2], I enjoy applying powerful packages provided by the `R` community to visualize cross-sectional and time-series patterns of American political behavior in both static and interactive forms. I do this mostly for fun but also to help myself uncover interesting modes in American politics that otherwise might be elusive to spot. Check some of the graphs I proudly made with the help of `{tidyverse}` in the [Gaphics](graphics.qmd) page.
[^2]: ``{=html} is actually such a powerhouse that I can almost conduct finish every stage of a research project entirely within the environment of `RStudio` , from data cleaning to in-depth analyses to writing the final manuscript! And despite my unapologetic love for R, I did set out my journey of quantitative social science in the arms of `Stata`, which I still use once in while for its stability and clarity in inspecting and labeling data. ## Education ``{=html} - BA in Philosophy, Politics and Economics (PPE) \| expected 2023 \| **Peking University** - Exchange Student, ASAP Parterships \| Dec 2021 \| **University of Notre Dame** ## Research Interests ``{=html} ::: columns ::: column - American Politics - Race and Ethnic Politics (REP) - Political Behavior - Public Opinion ::: ::: column - Politics of Identity - Racial Imagery - Social Cleavage - Partisanship - Affective Polarization ::: :::
